title: IT skill shortages facing IT leaders worldwide 2017 to 2019
summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 9 different IT categorys for 3 groups 2017, 2018, and 2019 that are presented on the X-axis.
Out of all 3 groups, 2018 had the highest Share of respondents for IT category Big data / analytics and 2017 had the lowest Share of respondents for IT category Artificial intelligence.
The maximum Share of respondents for 2019 that was found in IT category Big data / analytics was 0 times larger than the minimum Share of respondents observed in IT category Development.

On average, the IT category Big data / analytics had the highest Share of respondents for all 3 groups 2017, 2018, and 2019. Whereas Artificial intelligence had the lowest average Share of respondents.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 9 different IT categorys on X-axis for 3 groups 2017, 2018, and 2019. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.

max_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 9 different IT categorys on X-axis for 3 groups 2017, 2018, and 2019. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
Out of all 3 groups, 2018 had the highest Share of respondents for IT category Big data / analytics and 2017 had the lowest Share of respondents for IT category Artificial intelligence.
Among all the IT categorys, 2019 had the highest Share of respondents 44.0 in IT category Big data / analytics and lowest value 0.0 in IT category Development.
There is a gap of 44.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for 2019 in IT category Big data / analytics and Development.
Out of all 3 groups, the highest gap between the maximum and minimum Share of respondents was found in case of 2018.

2018 had the maximum Share of respondents out of all 3 groups in IT category Big data / analytics followed by 2018 in Big data / analytics, and the minimum Share of respondents is found for 2017 in Artificial intelligence.

On average, the IT category Big data / analytics had the highest Share of respondents for all 3 groups 2017, 2018, and 2019. Whereas Artificial intelligence had the lowest average Share of respondents.
